rules.natural: Whenever a company is successful, it follows that either the company licenses technology or the company does not patent an invention.
A company expands operations or a company partners with a firm.
If a company partners with a firm, then the company is successful.
Should a company be bankrupt, then the company is profitable.
In cases where a company is bankrupt, the company is not profitable.
Given that a company innovates, the company grows.
Under the condition that a company improves a service, the company grows.
Whenever a company researches AI, the company innovates.
A company researches AI or a company develops an algorithm.
A company acquires a startup or a company invests in technology.
Given that a company tests a prototype, it implies that if the company develops an algorithm, then the company improves a service.
A company tests a prototype or a company demonstrates a capability.
Provided that a company avoids failure, the company does not fail a project.
Under the condition that a company leads the industry, either the company develops software or the company grows.
If a company adopts a standard, then the company follows a trend.
Given that a company invests in technology, either the company develops software or the company grows.
If a company transforms its business, then the company does not stagnate.
A company transforms its business or a company evolves its strategy.
In cases where a company evolves its strategy, the company does not stagnate.
Provided that a company creates a division, the company innovates.
Under the condition that a company enhances its offering, the company improves a service.
Whenever a company markets a product, either the company develops software or the company grows.
A company patents an invention or a company does not compete with a rival.
If it is not the case that a company expanding operations implies the company is successful, then the company is bankrupt.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(demonstrates(company, capability) -> (develops(company, algorithm) -> improves(company, service))) -> fails(company, project))
rules.natural: Should it not be true that a company demonstrating a capability implies that if the company develops an algorithm then the company improves a service, then the company fails a project.
Provided that it is not the case that a company implementing a system implies the company adopts a standard, then the company rejects change.
Under the condition that it is not the case that a company implementing a system implies the company adopts a standard, then the company embraces innovation.
If it is not the case that a company embracing innovation implies the company does not reject change, then the company stagnates.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(merges(company, entity) | (creates(company, division) | enhances(company, offering))) -> dissolves(company, unit))
rules.natural: Should it not be true that a company merges with an entity or a company creates a division or a company enhances its offering, then the company dissolves a unit.
Given that it is not the case that a company merges with an entity or a company creates a division or a company enhances its offering, then the company does not dissolve a unit.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(announces(company, event) -> (launches(company, platform) -> (acquires(company, startup) -> markets(company, product)))) -> delays(company, release))
rules.natural: In cases where it is not the case that a company announcing an event implies that if the company launches a platform then if the company acquires a startup then the company markets a product, then the company delays a release.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(announces(company, event) -> (launches(company, platform) -> (acquires(company, startup) -> markets(company, product)))) -> -delays(company, release))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not the case that a company announcing an event implies that if the company launches a platform then if the company acquires a startup then the company markets a product, then the company does not delay a release.
Should a company not lead the industry, then the company implements a system.
Whenever a company does not grow, the company competes with a rival.

A company does not license technology.
A company does not follow a trend.
It is not the case that a company merges with an entity.
